reviews.text: Beautiful Carol service. Put me right in the Christmas mood. What an impressive building! Would highly recommend for a visit.
Tiny but One of most beautiful Cathedrals in England. Do not forget to make a 🌟SUPERB📸 and very informative Tower Tour! (brilliant Guides!!!)
Beautiful Bath Abbey... The place is colorful and crowded with people mainly on weekends. You can go to the top most part of the building and enjoy the top view of the beautiful city.

Awesome!!! The baths are super cool, much more to see, the museum is super informative.  It's crazy the way they warmed the water back then.  The statues of Caesar and other Roman figures around the bath ste awesome.  The whole place is just super cool.  Great views of the cathedral from the bath! Def worth a visit!
Under a lot of floor reconstruction work right now, so not fully open. Free entry, but a donation is protocol. Very helpful volunteers on hand.

While visiting Bath, we could not miss the opportunity to try the famous Sally's Buns. Once we found the shop, we starred at the window in admiration and excitement from looking at the buns on display! We stepped in this vintage building are were greeted by a lady dressed in a classic waitress dress which gave us a fantastic feeling of cosiness and enchantment. We ordered some recommended tea which was very very delicate to the taste and then obviously went for an English breakfast bun as well as the French breakfast bun. I personally thought the French breakfast bun lacked, let's say, creativity, but overall still very pleased with the taste of each buns. Those buns are a mixture between brioche and bread which makes them go well with either savory or sweet accompaniments. Let's put it this way, if you went to Bath and didn't try the experience of the historic house, with lovely dressed waitresses and those big buns served in multiple ways, then you must plan to go back!

Brilliant small museum that shows how Sally Lunn did her baking. It is down in the cellar so not easy for everyone to enter, but if you can this is a must see. We didn't eat here so cannot comment on the food, the bath bun we bought was amazing, light and delicious. Well worth a visit.

A lovely authentic British experience in this little restaurant. The staff were clearly very junior but still didn’t lack effort to make sure the service was efficient. The choice on the menu was vast and the value for money excellent, especially considering it is in such a touristy area! Would definitely recommend!

best bun I ever had! love to have it with either salty beef or sweet strawberry jam&cream...and when I leave I always bring home some buns with me... Bath is one of the cities I visited more times than other ones in the UK...definitely recommend a visit, and hopefully I can revisit someday in the future. And when I do, this is definitely the place I will go.

My recommendation is to go here as much for the famous bun (which I found pretty average, but my wife found quite good - it was light and fluffy and tasted good with butter, but so is every other bun. I didn't find the bun to be any extraordinary in taste) as for the nice, big, and varied menu. They have done fantastic innovation around what you can do with a bun and preparations are wholesome and tasteful. The decor is nice and then you have the history as well (oldest house in Bath!!)

The parade gardens have won lots of awards in Britain in bloom and always lots of colour all year round if you have a manual wheelchair with a strong person who can hang on down the  long ramp and pull or push you back up it's peaceful looking towards Poultney bridge and the Weir listening to the water is great but getting back up IT'S NOT FOR ANYONE WHO IS NOT FIT Ihave
Lovely and peaceful gardens in Central Bath.
Love the park
Nice outdoor picnic opportunities and close to town.  Handy...
Beautiful and serene, perfect for a stroll or just to sit on the grass overlooking the river Avon. The gardens are immaculate.

Its a wonderful park with something for everyone. It has a great children's playground, with everything you would expect, with swings, sliders...sand pits, climbing frames and more challenging things for bigger kids...there is a skateboard park, and a duck pond. There are gardens full of flowers to enjoy, tennis,bowls and golf, put and play and crazy golf..tea shops toilets and ice cream and a bandstand

Probably the most amazing free outdoor children’s park I’ve ever been to. The range of equipment is vast! Several wonderful jungle gyms, with slides varying from beginners level all the way to this humongous tunnel slide which actually I’d quite like to get on myself!! 

With sandpits and climbing walls, a zip wire and so many swings, two double swings (for two children or an adult and a little one) one fully backed swing, lots of regular ones and even two of those big circle rope ones. 

There is also a cafe with toilets attached however I believe there is a charge for these so bring change.

There is also a nice ratio of sunny to shaded areas.

I’d happily bring the children here one morning with picnic blankets and food and spend the whole day !!

We had very nice time walking around the park. It's big, it's beautiful and have a lot of space for activities. Just take your blanket and picnic basket and head to Victoria Park for a lovely day :)
And Botanical Garden next to it is just magical. Perfect place to spend a day enjoying great weather, beautiful area and walking.

Lovely park for a wall and some fresh air. 
Had a picnic by the duck  pond, with my baby. Lots of ducks for children to feed. Lovely and clean, no litter anywhere,  lots  of benches to sit on.
We never went in the park, as my baby is only 11 weeks, but in time, we will. 
We'll  be back
Fabulous park, something for everyone. Family friendly play area which has a huge range of play equipment for all ages. Also love the botanic gardens and big open spaces for picnics
Beautiful park, lovely range of interesting trees and architecture. The canal and railway cut through the middle with some cute bridges. Tennis courts, playground, maze, and a nearby café.
Slept here after a night out. Great benches and a short walk into town. Sadly I was woken up by dog walkers in the early hours next to the main road
Great place for pictures. Lighting amazing. The dogs are a plus. Always clean
One of the best gardens... you can take your time here and stay relax... ideally at summer time or when it's not raining

A beautiful parkland to stroll or just sit. Ornate Bath stone structures ask for your attention and wonder.
A variety of trees provide a haven for birds such as: Woodpecker, Jay, and Wagtails. Through Sydney gardens slowly whispers the Kennet and Avon Canal.
A place to just be.

Excellent place well layered out. The Royal section of outfit very good. There was a place where we could try different periods of time of fashion. The dresses were very heavy to put on. There were man's outfit as well. Children outfit also.

Fir fashion students it is great. I spent my life in the motion picture industry so costumes are of interest to me. Unfortunately we were unable to view most as lecturers and their hordes of students blocked the sight of the costumes. However, we very much enjoyed where you can try on some costumes

Wow. 1800 to 2000 era is well kept on the fashion collection. i even tried few dress from old collections gives a feeling to back to the past. nice and calm surroundings with great wealth of information about how the people has changed by ages.

If you are interested in fashion and you happen to be in Bath, definitely go. They give an audio guide so the visit is very informative. It makes you understand how much fashion has evolved and how history is affecting the fashion industry today.

Terrific, even if you think you're not that interested in fashion. Tells the story of changing styles up to present day. Great audio guide with short interesting clips, you can go quite deep or skip through quickly. Dressing up section adds a bit of fun and you're in Bath's Assembly Rooms so take a look at the fantastic ballrooms from Bath's Regency heyday.

Great little experience.  My daughters aged 6 and 9 really enjoyed it. You could make it last 1 hour or 3 - and still get lots from it. I also really enjoyed it. The waxwork Jane was amazing,  and writing with quills was a highlight for all three of us. The staff were really lovely too.

A little pricey but if your either really in to Jane Austen or like me aren't and didn't know much beforehand there's a comprehensive amount of detail that's well presented in a number of ways including informative films and in-character presentation. My daughter had the best time dressing up in the period costumes provided for the purpose. There's also a tea room for a very English tea experience which we did not have time to try but we did quickly check out the menu and did feel the prices were unreasonably high even with the 10% discount that the entry fee entitles you to. But this aside, the staff were friendly and informative and the experience was informative and enjoyable and gave an interesting insight into Regency society in Bath, especially if it's added to other tourist offerings such as the free guided walks, No. 1 Royal Crescent, the Assembly Rooms etc. Love Bath!!
Interesting info on a writer ahead of her time. The tea room was fabulous! Nice little gift shop. Enjoyed the visit.

A tourist trap, in three words. It costs £12 each with no discernible facts or relics. Tour padded out with video, talk and posters. A costume and a quill don't make an experience. The building has no connection to Austen either. The people are lovely and they do give an overview of Austen's family and brief excerpt of her life, but nothing to warrant £12 for an hours 'experience'. There seemed to be more focus on her extended family than Jane herself. Thoroughly disappointing and considering it sits so highly in 'places to visit in bath', makes you wonder if the local tourist board has visited it and given it their seal of approval. And if so, why?
The tour presenter did a great job. There just wasn't much in the way of viewing. It is a good education in how Jane Austen was inspired by Bath.
Beautiful displays and some are incredibly old you can't believe the quality definitely go see it

Formerly exquitise exhibits, small gem well worth a visit not expensive either! Sadly since a recent major burglary in 2018 Now much diminished (half of museum now closed due to terrible irreplaceable stolen exhibits). Deserves support nevertheless!

Excellent collection. Well displayed with good information. Spanning a wide part of history. I enjoyed the Song ceramics & jade carvings. Very representative collection with excellent publications available. Very friendly & helpful assistant.
A hidden gem in Bath. Fascinating place

An unusual retreat in the centre  of Georgian Bath. The collection of one man, Brian McElney, it shows a wide range of East Asian art, historically and in terms of medium, with small but thoughtful temporary exhibitions of contemporary artists too. An appalling, targeted burglary in March, has devastated the main collection, but this is still an excellent visit and the tiny shop has some lovely things too.

My 1st visit beautiful auditorium saw
EQUUS brilliant play, my friends said I wouldn't enjoy it but I loved it excellent acting.
One down point when actors were at back of stage it was a job to here what  they were saying and I was only in j5.
Went to The Greatest Shwoman Sing a long. It was lovely being able to go to something there at a reasonable price. Hope they do more of these. Ice creams are pricey though.
Lovely theatre. Seats better than most. Handy restaurants nearby

A great place to experience theatre, good acoustics, friendly staff and a really nice ambiance. 
The seating can be a bit cramped and access along the rows not easy, but the plus side is you can be really close to the stage and even at the rear of the stalls you are closer than in many west end top price seats. 
There is a restaurant and bars for pre-theatre food and drinks in subterranean surroundings (the old vaults), while these places have a great atmosphere they are totally impractical for disabled guests as all involve steps with no lifts  - yes I know the age and style of the building is a limitation but I would think at least one of the areas would be accessible?
Lovely theatre. Disabled access via a lift however the door sticks. Limited female loos so queues during the interval. Drinks and ice creams on the expensive side.

Woah this place was phenomenal, not only were the drinks delicious but the service was second to none. We had multiple servers check up on us during our stay even recommend drinks based on the local beer. The Bar plays amazing rock music and play live music on certain nights. We went to 6 bars that night and this one took the cake in every everything. Definitely a place worth checking out!

This is the best bar ever! They had a special for Dos Equis, where you buy a pint for $100 pesos and refill it as many times as you want from 5-11pm. It's safe to say we made the promotion worthwhile. The staff were super friendly and accommodating, and the food we ordered came quickly and was tasty.
Great food and atmosphere. Will be returning for the live music.
Good place to go get a beer. Good snacks and the best rock music. Live music during weekends. Gets crowded quite early. The shrimp pop corn is great. Good service. I love this place
Good place & music, mediocre food

We had a lovely relaxed brunch at Boston Tea Party. Really delicious pancakes and great coffee. Staff were friendly and the venue was very spacious and trendy. I also love and appreciate the eco focus of the cafe. 
The cakes near the counter looked so delicious too...next time!

Very busy locale in a beautiful part of Bath. Very big inside lots of seating and space. The menu is brunch and breakfast items. I had the chorizo hash which was nice and fresh tasting with a chocolate milkshake. I think the staff on this occasion was a little overwhelmed but it was 1400 on a Saturday so they can be forgiven. I like this chain a lot, it is a great place to get a quick bite.

Boston Team Party offers a range of high quality breakfast and lunch options. Family owned and regional based in the South West only they are a reliable chain for breakfast and brunch, or just coffee and cake.

The Alfred Street cafe/restaurant is my favourite, sett in a beautiful building with large windows and historic glass lantern the main area is full of natural light. Being an open plan layout and popular location means you get a feel for the Bath vibe, with young families and uni students often present.

Food and drinks are good quality, well priced and generously portioned. It’s a great place to start the day or stop for a mid morning pick-me-up.

Fabulous breakfast! Ordered the chorizo hash and the za’atar flat bread with lamb and both were delicious. Friendly staff and good service, nice open space with lots of tables (got a table immediately for Sunday brunch). Lots of lovely dogs with their owners.
Nice place, nice food. We had A problem with one of our orders and it took more than 20 min to get it. Staff very nice. Just try to be more fast when there is a problem with an order

Such a fantastic place!! Service is great and food to die for, and it’s all fresh!! You should totally sit on the floor on the low tables and if you have any dietary needs they’re great at looking after you!! I’m vegan and it was perfect - just go ❤️
Absolutely fabulous food.  Staff are friendly,  keen and efficient.  (Loo walls, floors and door could be a bit cleaner).

Really great atmosphere on the Saturday night we visited in early January. The food was amazing with great vegetarian and vegan options. Both the food and wine were very well priced. The staff were really friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be coming back.

Booked as is was a Saturday night.  It was full and they were turning people away so just as well.
Good food, service was excellent and so was the price.
Only reason for not giving 5 stars was that it was all a bit of a rush.  Almost no pause between courses meant we were home a bit earlier than expected.

What a superb restaurant. A great welcome, good beer, good wine and superb food. Everything was so tasty, from poppadoms to Momos, to the beautiful lamb dishes! Can't recommend this place enough, hope I'll get back again.
Simple but tasty, fresh and delicious food. Portions are not massive but the quality is great. Nicely decorated ideal for a romantic quiet dinner. Reccomended!
Always good food - but has it changed hands? No more non alcoholic cocktails and they seemed to have no recollection that they ever had them. Big shame, they were the driver's great consolation.
Went to Raphael for a dinner date and it was a great experience overall!! Great staff and amazing food!

Really like the space and atmosphere. Great wine, good service. As a vegetarian the food was a little disappointing, just a bit unexciting and the mille feuille starter was rather dry. The main had a lot more flavour. As often happens with restaurants that are mainly for meat eaters, there was a mushroom based main even though one of the two veggie starters was also mushroom. Thoughtless?
Lovely food and friendly staff found it great value for money, really enjoyed my visit there and would certainly go back best meal out I have had so far of 2019.
Food and service is just WoW..amazing..awesome..there is no words to describe it.

Visited for lunch with baby. Waitress very friendly, attentive and welcoming. Particularly family friendly, we were given a high chair, breadstick and crayons for our daughter as soon as we walked in. Food was as expected but a little expensive. Better quality than the likes of cafe uno or zizzi. This strada did not have a baby change facility and the manager also brought the bill over before we had even asked for it, giving the impression that he wanted us to leave, despite having three courses and spending a reasonable amount of money. Overall pretty decent.
Open Late. Historic site under exploited.
Great with discount voucher

Quality restaurant, always get good service and treated well here. Food is always very nice, going from the starters which are prepared well and with a wide range of options. Main courses are nicely well prepared as well. Cocktails choices are good.

We have just left Jamie’s Italian and I am so irritated, I wanted to write this review straight away.

The food was terrible, as I have a Nut Allergy the starter ended being Philadelphia on a chunk of bread with flakes of salmon. Not great. The main was just dolloped on the plate and looked really uncared for preparation wise. This is completely different from the first time we went about a year ago.

Now, the waitress - wow she really shouldn’t be in hospitality. She would come to our table, start talking then leave halfway through her sentence, still talking! A few odd looks were exchanged between my partner and I. The waitress pretty much chucked the plates on our table, same with the final bill then proceeded to try to shout out loud that we had left her just 88p (we actually tipped her low and left her £3 on top of the 88p because she was horrendous at her job). 

Would never return. Would get better at ASK.

My husband and I had a lovely meal at the restaurant on Saturday. It was our first visit and certainly will not be our last. Food was fab, drinks were very refreshing and service was amazing, I would actually go so far to say it was the best service we have come across in a long time. Can not fault it in any way.
I ate here a few times and I love it. Affordable prices and quality meals.

My daughter and I enjoyed a lovely meal here while visiting Bath.  My daughter is 5 and the spaghetti was a huge hit with her.  I choose a seafood stew from the specials and it was delicious.  The restaurant was busy, but the service was still brilliant

If you love curry (like I do) this is the place to go. Top quality food served in a magnificent upstairs dining area. Plenty of food and drink to choose from and the service is great. Enjoy the great tastes of India in this delightful setting

Beautiful venue with delicious food. Came here for a romantic dinner, got a nice table, not too cramped even for a Friday night. They have loads of space and spread the guests out evenly. Our server was very friendly. Food seemed to take a while, or maybe we were just so hungry the time passed slower... 
Would 100% come again.

I've had a few reasonable meals here but the quality of the food is average and service goes to pieces on busy nights (especially after a rugby match). My most recent experience was a 15 minute queue to be seated (even though I had a reservation), and then 35 minutes of being ignored (we were not even given a menu) before giving up and leaving. I might go back, but would only do so on a quiet night.

Great large curry house, very popular , I was a bit sceptical at first as it is big and thought the food might not be up to scratch. But it was lovely food with charming staff. They let us sit and chat till way after midnight.

Feels like an indian market hall! This place is huge and it is so popular! 
The food was amazing and there were so many amazing options on the menu. It wasnt expensive considering the portion sizes, however you do need to be decisive about what you want and how many servings you require.
I would put this in my top 10 Indian restaurants and I recommend you do the same!
Had plenty of Thai food over the years but I have to say mai thai is absolutely amazing. So authentic, so much flavour and cooked to perfection. Definitely be back. Wayne from South Wales 👍
It was delicious, we had the set meal for two, just about managed to eat it all. The waitress was friendly and helpful and the service was really good.

I'm really sad to say our visit to Mai Thia was very disappointing. We had a set meal. Our starters we lovely but we had a 'soup' and main dishes were basically tasteless except for the beef dish which had an overpowering aniseed flavour. Lemongrass had been chopped into the dishes therefore every mouthful you had, you were picking the hard lemongrass out. I did mention to the waitress this wasn't to my liking but she said that's what Thia food is like! The dessert was banana fritters, and like the starter thus was nice. I love Thia food and have had the pleasure of eating in a few Thia restusrants but Mai Thia really has a different take on This food!! If this was your first experience of Thia food, I don't think you would want to eat Thia again.
Wonderful food and service, plus free parking outside.
Lovely authentic Thai restaurant. Friendly staff, generous portions, great food. Nice laid-back vibe -- a lovely neighbourhood restaurant.
Surprised by some of these reviews - you’ll never please everyone. Genuinely the best cookies I’ve ever tasted, bought my first box last week and will definitely be back for more!
We love Bens cookies and they had a fab range of flavours here
Great cookies and coffees really worked well. I lived the peanut butter cookie, a real treat
Quite possibly the tastiest cookie I've ever had! Expensive, but to be expected.

Great for cookies. Moist and freshly baked. Lots of variety. 

The milkshakes are average and I wouldn’t have again. But the cookies are a must 👍🏼👍🏼

I've lost count with the amount of times I've been here and whilst I tend to have the same choice - Hawaiian Chicken (Double) - the burgers and fries are incredible. 

In fact, I've never had a bad meal here and always crave one whenever it's lunchtime and I'm in or around Bath. Arguably the best burgers I've had.

Best Burgers ever. I have waited 11 years to eat one after returning on a trip to Bath. It was worth the wait and the vege, mayo and blue cheese burger still tastes if not better after all these years👍😎😊
The best burger I've ever tasted! I'm now vegetarian and the only things that tempt me to eat meat are Schwartz Bros burgers and Nandos butterfly chicken. Haven't tried their vegetarian burgers yet.

Great quality burger and service was good even though the place was full of customers.  The only thing against it was that the place is  small and you have to queue outside at busy times in the weekend evening's.
Amazing food. A great selection of Veggie burgers. Delicious ....

Been coming here for 30 years on special occasions birthday's etc. We have to travel for and hour and 15 minutes each way to get my amazing garlic burger. Really dissapointed this time as the burger had hardly any garlic mayo in it and hardly any lettuce onions etc normally it's juicy and gorgeous and so worth waiting for I then opened the pot of garlic mayo only to find that was only half full as well so pretty dissapointed all round tonight. Makes me wonder about going so far again as and breaking our tradition.
Not alot can beat a mr ds after a night out
Very tasty! Enjoyed every bit.
Over priced for what you get to be honest. Burgers are decent and you there are plenty to choose from. Would not recommend getting fries.
Love this place, one of my favorite takeaways

I love this place. The bagels are divine and assembled fresh in front of you, this place is a real gem and I never want to go to Bath without getting one of their delicious bagels. The New Yorker is good, if a little heavy on the mustard, but the French Brie and Pear completely blew it away, easily the best bagel I've ever had!
Just ate a stunning new yorker bagel, very tasty, great helpful staff and service. Will definitely be back to try the others.

Bad customer service. Apparently you need to explicitly ask (so they told me after I  had asked) for a meal deal because the staff doesnt feel obliged to inform you, and is more than happy to charge you for each item separately.

Terrible service, and very unhelpful staff. 

Seriously lacking in customer service skills.

Service with a snarl!  

We arrived at 15:50 and we were greeted with 'we close in 10 mins'.  I think this was meant to be - 'thanks for your custom, but we're closing in 10 mins, but you're welcome to order a takeaway'.  

There was then a mix up with the order, at which point I was informed that I'd not communicated the order well enough.  I let this slide as I was with my two children (5 & 7).  I asked them to remake the order and again it was wrong.  

The photo attached shows the order as it was written (it looks pretty straight forward).  

This time it was my fault for the error again and after more snide comments from the senior person, I was informed that I'd ordered something that wasn't allowed.  At this point, I raised the fact that the menu is pretty clear and lists what I ordered.  Again, it was still felt to be my fault.  At this point I called up the snarling service and that telling me I've ordered something that isn't allowed post event is pretty annoying (i.e. tell me up front before I've paid).  

We had a 'ding dong', until the senior person apologised.
   
So what have I learnt from this experience - It's right to call up people that are being rude to you, whether you're a customer or in any other circumstance (I waited until the 3rd incident).  There's also a time to walkaway, before you really lose your cool.  The order was still wrong and my children wouldn't eat the bagel as it wasn't toasted.   An interesting experience.
Simple but tasty, fresh and delicious food. Portions are not massive but the quality is great. Nicely decorated ideal for a romantic quiet dinner. Reccomended!
Always good food - but has it changed hands? No more non alcoholic cocktails and they seemed to have no recollection that they ever had them. Big shame, they were the driver's great consolation.
Went to Raphael for a dinner date and it was a great experience overall!! Great staff and amazing food!

Really like the space and atmosphere. Great wine, good service. As a vegetarian the food was a little disappointing, just a bit unexciting and the mille feuille starter was rather dry. The main had a lot more flavour. As often happens with restaurants that are mainly for meat eaters, there was a mushroom based main even though one of the two veggie starters was also mushroom. Thoughtless?
Lovely food and friendly staff found it great value for money, really enjoyed my visit there and would certainly go back best meal out I have had so far of 2019.
